current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To provide for a smart water resource management pilot program.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Environment and Public Works

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Smart Water Resource Management Conservation and Efficiency Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Smart Water Resource Management Conservation and Efficiency Act of 2014

Smart water

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Smart Water Resource Management Conservation and Efficiency Act of 2014/s:2/ss:b

header.#text:
Smart water
		resource management pilot program

Smart water
		resource management pilot program

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall establish and
		carry out a smart water resource management pilot program in accordance with
		this section.

text.#text: The

The
		purpose of the smart water resource management pilot program is to award grants
		to eligible entities to demonstrate novel and innovative technology-based
		solutions that will—

improve water,
		wastewater, and water reuse systems to help communities across the United
		States make significant progress in conserving water, saving energy, and
		reducing costs; and

support the
		implementation of innovative processes and the installation of advanced
		automated systems that provide real-time data on energy and water.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall make
		competitive, merit-reviewed grants under the pilot program to not less than 3,
		but not more than 5, eligible entities.

text.#text: The

energy
		and cost savings;

the
		novelty of the technology to be used;

the
		anticipated cost-effectiveness of the pilot project in terms of energy
		efficiency savings, water savings or reuse, and infrastructure costs
		averted;

whether
		the technology can be deployed in a variety of geographic regions and the
		degree to which the technology can be implemented on a smaller or larger scale;
		and

whether the
		project will be completed in 5 years or less.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall consider—
